result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 22R 014994.   Posted by C. Kubnick. olg

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call Justice Support Center at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus   DF:  Jason Lee Ray Defoor appeared from jail. Case called at 10:36 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Becker calls Deputy Johnson to the Stand. S/T Eric Johnson. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Firkus. Witness excused. ADA Becker requesting Court take judicial notice of Chippewa County bond 21CF235. Requesting bind over. Atty Firkus gives argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Schedules for arraignment. Bond continues in form and amount. Court adjourned at 10:52 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Atty Firkus. km

01:23 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today  DF:  Jason Leeray Defoor appeared from jail. Defendant qualifies for PD.  DE confirms address, but may be going to Grace Place when he's released, and confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. PO Hold. Bond argument; bond ordered. Atty Satorius waives speedy prelim based upon the fact that DE will remain in custody until a revocation hearing occurs in a prior matter. Court sets Prelim.
